content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• This structure forms the production interface for copper cables. It gathers materials from an input chest and feeds them via an inserter into an assembling machine.
• Consists of:
 – Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
 – Factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) (placed using direction RIGHT)
 – Assembling machine (assembling-machine-1) at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Belt Depot Structure at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
• This structure serves as an isolated depot for multi‐segment belt connections between the extraction system and factory interface.
• Consists of:
 – Wooden chest (belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
 – Transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) placed adjacent to the chest
 – Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (placed using direction UP) which facilitates item pickup from the depot

ERROR TIPS

• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
 – When connecting transport belts, do not target a Prototype.SteamEngine directly. Instead, attach an inserter that feeds into the steam engine so that the belt’s endpoint is a valid target.

• Wooden Chest Placement Errors  
 – Ensure that the target placement position is within the allowed distance by moving closer before placing.  
 – Verify the inventory contains the required wooden chest prior to placement to avoid “no wooden_chest in inventory” errors.

• Undefined Variable Reference  
 – Confirm that all variables (for example, ensuring “target_chest” is defined) are correctly declared and referenced consistently to avoid NameError exceptions.
